quote.text: Lift as heavy as possible, as much volume as possible, while remaining as fresh as possible.
quote.author: Steve Freides

what.title: StrongCode
what.description: StrongCode is a strength training system that breaks away from traditional programs. Instead of following rigid set × rep schemes, it uses dynamic volume and intensity planning to maximize your strength gains while minimizing fatigue.
what.sidebar1: StrongCode combines programming principles with strength training methodology.
what.sidebar2: The dynamic approach adapts to individual needs and capabilities.

who.title: Who is it for
who.description: StrongCode is designed for intermediate and advanced lifters who:
who.point1: Have mastered proper technique in their chosen lifts
who.point2: Have established baseline 1RMs that haven't improved on linear progression
who.point3: Want to break through plateaus in any of these lifts:

expect.title: What to expect
expect.paragraph1: It promises progression for most lifters, focusing on long-term development and long-lasting results.
expect.paragraph2: Can we promise exceptional results? Certainly not. Outcomes vary greatly from person to person and are influenced by external factors beyond the program's control.
expect.paragraph3: However, keep stress levels low, have quality sleep, and maintain a balanced diet, and you're setting the stage for success.

features.title: Features
features.sidebar1: Each program is uniquely crafted based on individual characteristics and goals.
features.sidebar2: The dynamic approach to volume and intensity creates an engaging and effective training experience.

tailored.title: Individually Tailored
tailored.description: Each program is tailored according to your specific characteristics, abilities, and goals. Thus it is practically impossible for two people to receive the exact same program.

unique.title: Unique
unique.paragraph1: StrongCode provides a new way of training. Most likely, you have not experienced anything like this before. What might seem chaotic on a first glance is underpinned by several patterns and principles tried and tested over decades.
unique.paragraph2: Key differences from traditional programs include:
unique.point1: High variability of volume (between sessions, weeks, and months)
unique.point2: Volume and intensity are planned independently on each other
unique.point3: High variability of intensity zones in each workout
unique.paragraph3: You will simultaneously practice different intensity zones with varying volumes during each training session. The volume in these zones dynamically changes according to several rules and patterns, not only between training sessions but also between weeks and months.

joyful.title: Joyful and satisfying
joyful.description: Each session is different, ensuring a continually satisfying training experience. No more same and boring set × rep schemes.

longterm.title: Long term
longterm.paragraph1: If you provide correct data, you should never train on the edge of failure using StrongCode. This alone significantly lowers the probability of injuries.
longterm.paragraph2: Dynamically changing the volume between sessions / weeks / months also significantly lowers the possibility of overtraining. This makes StrongCode a great system for long-term progress.

hypertrophy.title: Hypertrophy?
hypertrophy.description: Curious about hypertrophy? While StrongCode focuses on strength, the program can be adjusted to include hypertrophy goals for a balanced approach. By tweaking certain parameters during the program's creation, it is possible to focus either on strength alone or on both strength and hypertrophy for any of the lifts. Just let us know.

benefits.title: Benefits
benefits.point1: Better flexibility of training sessions within a week, and weeks within a month.
benefits.point2: More variety of rep ranges at a given load helps to remove psychological barriers associated with those weights.
benefits.point3: Staying farther away from xRM at given weights lefts you more fresh even after a high volume trainings.
benefits.point5: Fewer overuse and nagging injuries or other setbacks.
benefits.point6: Increased frequency of heavy attempts, which develops confidence and consistency.
benefits.point7: Shorter peaks: you are always around 5% close to peak, which also means shorter taper periods.

howItWorks.title: How it works
howItWorks.sidebar1: The program creation process combines scientific analysis with experienced coaching.
howItWorks.sidebar2: Dynamic programming allows for optimal volume and intensity distribution across different time scales.

inputs.paragraph1: Based on a detailed questionnaire and the coach's know-how, the initial program parameters are derived from a large amount of input. Inputs include basic factors (gender, age, height, weight), as well as various parameters of your training history (e.g., tolerance to higher/lower volumes for a given lift), strength curves of all lifts, etc.
inputs.paragraph2: Then comes the art of the coach, who composes the entire detailed program from the calculated parameters. Nothing algorithmic, only the creative abilities and experience of the program's creator.

result.paragraph1: The result is a program that spans a minimum of 2 months, divided into two key phases: preparatory and peak.
result.paragraph2: While a 2-month duration is the absolute minimum for effectiveness, extending the preparatory phase to 2 or more months provides significantly better results. A longer preparatory phase allows for greater strength development and a smoother transition into the peak phase, maximizing overall performance.

lookInside.title: Look inside
lookInside.sidebar1: The program creation process combines scientific analysis with experienced coaching.
lookInside.sidebar2: Dynamic programming allows for optimal volume and intensity distribution across different time scales.

beginners.title: Why not for beginners?
beginners.description: For beginners, progress is largely a function of intensity / weight on the bar. The programming is quite simple: just keep the volume at the same levels and try to increase weight on the bar. As one becomes more advanced, progress increasingly depends on the volume and its proper distribution across sessions, weeks, months, and even years. The more advanced you are, the more complex programming is needed. And this is where StrongCode plays its role.

model.title: Linear, wave, and dynamic model
model.description: Both the linear and wave models use an inverse relationship between volume and intensity. What sets StrongCode apart is that volume and intensity are independent variables. Treating volume and intensity independently allows for more diversity in programming, creating a highly adaptable training plan.

factors.title: Key Factors Considered When Creating Your Program
factors.paragraph1: Key considerations include the balance of volume and intensity over time, ensuring optimal recovery and progress.
factors.point1: volume per year / month / week / session
factors.point2: average intensity per year / month / week / session
factors.point3: distribution of the volume between months / in a month / week / session
factors.point4: distribution of the average intensity between months / in a month / week / session

dynamics.title: Training Dynamics
dynamics.paragraph1: StrongCode avoids stagnation by varying both volume and intensity throughout your training cycle. Changes are customized to each lifter based on their experience, goals, and recovery capacity.
dynamics.paragraph2: Both volume and (average) intensity are changing:
dynamics.point1: Each workout is different - mixing heavy, moderate, and light weights with varying volumes.
dynamics.point2: Unlike traditional programs that follow predictable patterns and small changes, volume shifts can be dramatic, e.g. week 1: high, week 2: low, week 3: high, week 4: moderate.
dynamics.point3: Long-term changes are designed to peak your strength when it matters most, such as for a competition or a personal best attempt.
dynamics.keyTakeaway: This dynamic model isn't random—it's a carefully calculated approach rooted in decades of strength training research. By continuously adjusting volume and intensity, StrongCode ensures consistent progress, prevents overtraining, and keeps you mentally and physically engaged throughout the program.

ladders.title: Why do we use ladders so extensively?
ladders.description: Because ladders are great to manage high volumes and at the same time keep neural and metabolic fatigue low.

price.title: Price
price.sidebar1: All prices include detailed program creation and ongoing support.
price.sidebar2: Choose longer programs for better value and more comprehensive progress.

base.title: Base Price
base.amount: 39 USD / EUR per lift per month
base.example1: 2 month program for 3 powerlifts: 39×3×2 = 234 USD / EUR
base.example2: 3 month program for 3 powerlifts: 39×3×3 = 351 USD / EUR

about.title: About
about.sidebar1: The unique combination of programming expertise and strength coaching creates a systematic approach to strength development.
about.sidebar2: Each program represents a perfect balance between computational precision and coaching creativity.

intro.title: Marcel Balas
intro.description: Marcel Balas is the key figure behind StrongCode, skillfully combining his expertise as:
intro.point1: Software developer originally specializing in high-performance computing

vision.title: Vision
vision.description: StrongCode combines advanced computational analysis with real-world strength training expertise. Each program is built using precise calculations and refined through expert coaching to match your specific needs.

cta.title: Ready to get stronger?
cta.description: Contact us to discuss your strength goals and get started with StrongCode.

survey.title: Initial Survey
survey.subtitle: Be Strong Advanced Survey
survey.description: This survey helps us understand your current level and create an optimal training program for you. It takes approximately 10-15 minutes to complete.
